definition: to use up/to exhaust
to exhaust
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost

sentences.english: The workers laid about them to increase production.
sentences.chinese: 工人們竭盡全力增加生產。

sentences.english: Although the stone inflammation does utmost, still had lost to Chen Fei.
sentences.chinese: 雖然石炎竭盡全力，仍是輸給了陳飛。

sentences.english: It seemed a poor excuse now, in the aftermath of such exhausting passion.
sentences.chinese: 如此竭盡激情的結果似乎是很可卑的理由。

sentences.english: Craig was an old friend, and I had done my best to bring them together.
sentences.chinese: 克雷格是我的老朋友，我竭盡全力讓他們一起合作。

sentences.english: Weak is the effort of my heart and cold my warmest thought;
sentences.chinese: 我雖竭盡熱誠讚美，仍力薄心冷淡。

sentences.english: McConnell said Republicans would fight the health-care legislation as hard as they could.
sentences.chinese: 麥康奈爾說，共和黨人將竭盡全力反對健保法案。

sentences.english: The prime minister would go to any lengths to keep his government in power.
sentences.chinese: 首相會竭盡全力務使他的政府能繼續執政。

sentences.english: “We are striving to learn from the Japanese event,” says Becker.
sentences.chinese: “我們在竭盡全力從日本事件中汲取教訓，”貝克說。

sentences.english: Alvin will do anything to carry out his goal.
sentences.chinese: 艾文會竭盡所能來實現他的目標。

sentences.english: I tried my best to get some points for Toyota.
sentences.chinese: 我竭盡全力想爲豐田車隊掙得一些分數。

sentences.english: Suk is a good player and he always does his utmost.
sentences.chinese: 石是一名很棒的球員，並且他總是竭盡全力。

sentences.english: We are doing everything in our power to offer support and help.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在竭盡全力地提供支援和幫助。

sentences.english: So we do what we can to understand them, to be ready for change.
sentences.chinese: 所以我們竭盡全力去弄懂它們，爲改變做好準備。

sentences.english: We try to achieve what we can afford, and to achieve our mission.
sentences.chinese: 我們竭盡所能，力求不辱使命。

sentences.english: We must do all we can to minimise the risk of similar mis-haps recurring.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須竭盡所能，儘量防止再有類似事件發生。

sentences.english: China has help the tsunami-hit regions of Asia.
sentences.chinese: 中國承諾竭盡全力幫助受海嘯襲擊的亞洲地區。

definition: see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
diligent and attentive/assiduous/sincere
selfless/impartial
neighborly relations
to apply to/to put into (practice etc)/to put to (a test, a vote etc)
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
scholastic attainments
loyal/sincere/sound
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to praise
